title: The Volatility Effect: Lower Risk without Lower Return
authors: Blitz, David C.; van Vliet, Pim
abstract: Stocks with low volatility earn high risk-adjusted returns. The annual alpha spread of global low versus high volatility decile portfolios amounts to 12% over the 1986-2006 period. The volatility effect is observed within the US, European and Japanese markets, and cannot be explained by value and size effects.
notes: 低波動異常效應的原始論文（2007）。核心發現：低波動股票獲得更高的風險調整報酬，全球低波動 vs 高波動十分位投資組合年化 alpha 差距達 12%。此效應在美國、歐洲、日本市場皆存在，且無法被 value 和 size 因子解釋。此研究為 Robeco 低波動策略的學術基礎，paper_009 (2019) 為其後續更新版本。
